intro: Senecio choiquelauensis, commonly known as the Choiqueleu senecio, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in the Andean regions of Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh, high-altitude conditions. Its yellow flowers are usually small and clustered, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species with specific ecological requirements.
